metadata.title: 8-Week SQL Study Group Syllabus
metadata.description: Comprehensive week-by-week breakdown with specific LeetCode problems and learning objectives
metadata.target_audience: SQL learners progressing from basic to intermediate level

weeks.title: Introduction to Databases & Basic SELECT Queries
weeks.intro: This week will cover the basics of databases and SQL. We will start with the basics of databases and SQL, and then move on to more advanced topics.
learning_objectives: Write simple queries to retrieve and filter specific columns

leetcode.title: 1757. Recyclable and Low Fat Products
leetcode.description: Basic SELECT and WHERE with AND

leetcode.title: 595. Big Countries
leetcode.description: Basic SELECT and WHERE with OR

leetcode.title: 584. Find Customer Referee
leetcode.description: Basic SELECT and WHERE with IS NULL or !=

additional_resources.title: Mode Analytics SQL Tutorial: Basic SQL

weeks.note: Make sure you are checking for updates on Slack for important announcements.

weeks.title: Advanced Filtering, Aliases, & Introduction to Aggregate Functions
core_concepts: Advanced WHERE operators (AND, OR, NOT, IN, BETWEEN, LIKE)
Handling NULL values (IS NULL, IS NOT NULL)
Introduction to Aggregate Functions (COUNT(), SUM(), AVG(), MIN(), MAX()) without GROUP BY
learning_objectives: Use basic aggregates on entire tables

sqlzoo.title: 6. SUM and COUNT
sqlzoo.description: Focus on aggregates without GROUP BY

leetcode.title: 183. Customers Who Never Order
leetcode.description: Uses NOT IN or LEFT JOIN... IS NULL, good for NULL understanding early on, though JOIN is formally later

leetcode.title: 1683. Invalid Tweets
leetcode.description: Uses LENGTH function, CHAR_LENGTH in MySQL, introduces a simple function with WHERE

leetcode.title: 1148. Article Views I
leetcode.description: Simple SELECT DISTINCT, WHERE, ORDER BY - distinct is also a good concept here

weeks.title: Grouping Data with GROUP BY & HAVING
core_concepts: Using aggregate functions with GROUP BY

leetcode.title: 596. Classes More Than 5 Students
leetcode.description: Classic GROUP BY and HAVING

leetcode.title: 1729. Find Followers Count
leetcode.description: GROUP BY, COUNT, ORDER BY

leetcode.title: 1050. Actors and Directors Who Cooperated At Least Three Times
leetcode.description: GROUP BY multiple columns, COUNT, HAVING

weeks.title: Joining Tables â€“ INNER & LEFT JOINs
learning_objectives: Write INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN queries
Understand how NULLs are handled in LEFT JOINs

leetcode.title: 175. Combine Two Tables
leetcode.description: Basic LEFT JOIN

leetcode.title: 586. Customer Placing the Largest Number of Orders
leetcode.description: Can be solved with JOIN, GROUP BY, ORDER BY, LIMIT. Subquery or CTE is also an option learned later

leetcode.title: 197. Rising Temperature
leetcode.description: Requires a JOIN (often self-join conceptually or using date functions) and comparing values from different rows/dates. Note: Could also use LAG() which is a window function, but good to try with JOINs first

weeks.title: More JOINs, Subqueries & Common Table Expressions (CTEs)

leetcode.title: 181. Employees Earning More Than Their Managers
leetcode.description: Classic SELF JOIN or subquery

leetcode.title: 182. Duplicate Emails
leetcode.description: Can use GROUP BY and HAVING, or a subquery with IN

leetcode.title: 627. Swap Salary
leetcode.description: This is an UPDATE statement, good for a brief look at DML, but primarily for CASE statement logic. If focusing purely on SELECT practice for this week, maybe 176. Second Highest Salary which uses subqueries/CTEs/offset

leetcode.title: 176. Second Highest Salary
leetcode.description: Good for subqueries, OFFSET, or even window functions later

additional_resources.title: Mode Analytics SQL Tutorial: Subqueries & CTEs

weeks.title: String Functions, Date/Time Functions & Data Types
core_concepts: String manipulation (CONCAT, SUBSTRING, LENGTH, UPPER, LOWER, REPLACE, TRIM)
Date/time functions (NOW(), CURRENT_DATE, EXTRACT(), DATE_ADD(), DATE_FORMAT())

sqlzoo.title: Apply functions within problems from previous sections
sqlzoo.description: Look for function examples in Numeric Examples section

leetcode.title: 1484. Group Sold Products By The Date
leetcode.description: Uses GROUP_CONCAT (MySQL specific, but concept of string aggregation), COUNT DISTINCT, GROUP BY date

leetcode.title: 1527. Patients With a Condition
leetcode.description: Uses LIKE for pattern matching, good string practice

leetcode.title: 196. Delete Duplicate Emails
leetcode.description: This is a DELETE problem, but often involves subqueries to identify duplicates first. Good conceptual DML practice. Alternatively, 1667. Fix Names in a Table for string functions like UPPER, LOWER, CONCAT, SUBSTRING

leetcode.title: 1667. Fix Names in a Table
leetcode.description: Excellent for UPPER, LOWER, SUBSTRING, CONCAT

additional_resources.title: SQL dialect documentation
additional_resources.description: Refer to documentation for your specific SQL dialect (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) for string and date/time functions. W3Schools is a good quick reference.

weeks.note: This week relies more on other resources for function-specific practice.

weeks.title: Data Definition Language (DDL) & Data Manipulation Language (DML)
core_concepts: DDL (CREATE TABLE, ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE, basic constraints)
learning_objectives: Understand WHERE clause importance in DML

sqlzoo.title: SQLZoo is query-focused
sqlzoo.description: Practice DDL/DML in a local database

leetcode.title: 627. Swap Salary
leetcode.description: Actually an UPDATE problem. Good for DML practice.

leetcode.title: 196. Delete Duplicate Emails
leetcode.description: A DELETE problem. Requires identifying rows to delete, often with a subquery.

additional_resources.title: Local database setup
additional_resources.description: SQLite via DB Browser for SQLite, PostgreSQL, MySQL

additional_resources.title: Mode Analytics SQL Tutorial: DDL and DML

weeks.note: Focus for this week: Set up a local database (e.g., SQLite). Try to CREATE the tables from LeetCode problems. INSERT some sample data. UPDATE it. DELETE it. This hands-on practice is crucial for DDL/DML.

weeks.title: Introduction to Window Functions & Comprehensive Review
learning_objectives: Apply basic PARTITION BY and ORDER BY

sqlzoo.title: 10. Self join
sqlzoo.description: Review, or see if window functions offer alternative solutions

leetcode.title: 177. Nth Highest Salary
leetcode.description: Can be solved with window functions, subqueries, or LIMIT/OFFSET

leetcode.title: 184. Department Highest Salary
leetcode.description: Find employees who have the highest salary in each department. Uses JOIN and can be elegantly solved with window functions or subqueries

leetcode.title: 626. Exchange Seats
leetcode.description: Uses CASE statements and window functions like LEAD, LAG, or ROW_NUMBER can simplify logic

leetcode.title: 185. Department Top Three Salaries
leetcode.description: Classic window function problem with DENSE_RANK or RANK

additional_resources.title: Mode Analytics SQL Tutorial: Window Functions

weeks.note: Comprehensive Review: Revisit challenging problems, mixed problem sets, Q&A.

study_tips: Practice Regularly: Dedicate at least 2-3 hours per week to hands-on practice
Join Online Communities: Participate in SQL forums and Discord communities
Build Projects: Apply learned concepts to real-world scenarios
Document Progress: Keep notes on challenging concepts and solutions
Review Regularly: Revisit previous weeks' material to reinforce learning
